main event: A bright, round object was observed hovering in the sky for 10 minutes near Detroit Lakes, Minnesota on September 25, 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as round, the size of a dime at arm's length, and turned from black to a red glow.
The object seemed to move towards the southeast and gain a little altitude.
The witness, a 29-year-old former jet mechanic in the USAF, had no reason to doubt his veracity.
The weather conditions were clear, except for some broken clouds to the west at 10,000 feet.
No unusual objects were detected during this period by the Grand Forks Air Defense Sector.
